title: Luigi Burlando
text:
Luigi Burlando (; 23 January 1899 – 12 December 1967) was an <a href="Italians">Italian</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> and manager. He also played <a href="water%20polo">water polo</a>.
Club career.
Originally from <a href="Genoa">Genoa</a>, he played all of his career in his hometown, starting off with <a href="U.C.%20Sampdoria">Doria</a>, before spending a decade with <a href="Genoa%20C.F.C.">Genoa</a>.
International career.
At international level, Burlando most notably represented <a href="Italy%20national%20football%20team">Italy</a> at the <a href="Football%20at%20the%201920%20Summer%20Olympics">1920</a> and the <a href="Italy%20at%20the%201924%20Summer%20Olympics">1924 Summer Olympics</a>. He made 19 appearances for Italy in total between 1920 and 1925, scoring once. He also competed in the <a href="Water%20polo%20at%20the%201920%20Summer%20Olympics">men's water polo tournament</a> at the <a href="1920%20Summer%20Olympics">1920 Summer Olympics</a>.
